oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - American Ace - 1947-11-08 - Part 3
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 3 of excerpts from an American Ace sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment (7:30-8:00 pm) from November 8, 1947. Featuring Grant Turner (host/announcer), and performers Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, Jimmy Riddle, the Smoky Mountain Belles, Bashful Brother Oswald, and Tommy Jackson. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Jimmy Riddle; Smoky Mountain Belles; Bashful Brother Oswald; Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys; Tommy Jackson
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Roy Acuff introduces Jimmy Riddle -- Kansas City Blues (Jimmy Riddle harmonica) -- Roy Acuff introduces the Smoky Mountain Belles -- The Leaf Of Love (Smoky Mountain Belles) -- Roy Acuff introduces Bashful Brother Oswald -- Free Little Bird (Bashful Brother Oswald) -- Roy Acuff talks -- Turn Your Radio On (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) -- Roy Acuff introduces Tommy Jackson -- Chicken Reel (Tommy Jackson fiddle) -- American Ace Coffee commercial (Grant Turner) -- Theme (Ida Red) -- Closing statement (Roy Acuff)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Grand ole opry (Radio program); Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; Riddle, Jimmy, 1918-1982; Wilson, Lonnie; Bashful Brother Oswald; Smoky Mountain Belles; Jackson, Tommy; Turner, Grant;
